ol.li: Employees performing Lockout Tagout Tryout shall be aware of all manufacturer and in-plant instructions prior to performing work.

A machine profile shall be developed for each type of machinery or equipment covered by this program to identify the proper Lockout Tagout Tryout procedures for that type of equipment using Form EHS-02-107-F 001 Lockout Tagout Machine Profile or equivalent and shall be available at all times to authorized and affected employees.
An equivalent form may be used that provides the following information:
Identity of the machinery or equipment
Type and magnitude of energy
Machine Shutdown
Local Energy Isolations
Release of any stored energy
Lockout Tagout of all energy sources
Testing (“Tryout”)
Restart
Before shutdown, the authorized employee shall notify all affected employees of the lockout.
The authorized employee shall identify and isolate all local energy feed locations for the types of the energy to be controlled.
Lockout Tagout Tryout shall be followed according to Work Instruction EHS-03-008 Lockout Tagout Tryout or equivalent.
Lockout Tagout Tryout shall only be performed by authorized employees or contractors.

Lockout Tagout Tryout shall use both locks to isolate energy and tags to identify the system has been isolated.
Tagout alone may be used on a device which is incapable of being locked out. When tagout alone is used, a double tagout method shall be implemented. The tags must be located as close as safely possible to the energy isolating device as well as the main energy feed (panel), in a position that must be immediately obvious to anyone attempting to operate the device.
When Tagout alone is used, the facility must consider additional means to ensure full employee protection through the implementation of additional safety measures such as the removal of an isolating circuit element, blocking of a controlling switch, opening an extra disconnecting device, or the removal of a valve handle to reduce the likelihood of inadvertent energization.
